descriptions: No attempt to graph the equations or the graphs are completely inaccurate.
Graphs one equation correctly but the other is either missing or significantly flawed.
Graphs both equations, but with noticeable errors that affect the solution.
Graphs both equations mostly correctly with only minor inaccuracies.
Accurately graphs both equations, demonstrating understanding of slope and y-intercept.
Graphs both equations perfectly and uses the graph to clearly identify the solution to the system.
No attempt to solve algebraically or uses inappropriate methods.
Attempts to use an algebraic method (substitution or elimination) but makes significant errors early in the process.
Uses an algebraic method but makes errors that prevent finding the correct solution.
Solves the system algebraically, but makes a minor error that leads to an incorrect answer.
Correctly solves the system of equations algebraically, showing each step clearly.
Solves the system efficiently and accurately, and clearly explains the algebraic steps.
Does not provide any interpretation of what the solution represents.
Attempts to interpret the solution, but the explanation is unclear or incorrect.
Provides a partial interpretation of the solution but misses key aspects.
Interprets the solution in context, but with some lack of clarity or detail.
Clearly interprets the solution in the context of the problem, explaining what the values represent.
Provides a thorough and insightful interpretation of the solution, demonstrating a deep understanding of its meaning and implications.
